name: Strawberry Snow
description: "On an instrument you start from one tone. In painting you start from several. Thus you begin with black and divide up to white – the first unit, the easiest and the most frequently used one, hence the best understood. but take as many units as there are colors in the rainbow, add those made by composite colors, and you will reach a rather respectable number of units. What an accumulation of numbers, truly a Chinese puzzle! No wonder then that the colorist's science has been so little investigated by the painters and is so little understood by the public. Yet what richness of means to attain an intimate relationships with nature... the combinations are unlimited." - Gaugin Color Visualization Software Using color software that I created, images are imported, analyzed and the color palettes are then visualized. The more popular the color, the larger the circle. The location of each circle is based the hue, saturation and brightness. The hue defines where the image is placed on the x-axis. The saturation and brightness are used to define the location of the circle on the y-axis. Edition 1 of 1. Signed & hand numbered. Dimensions 13 x 19", 33.02 x 48.26cm (Paper) 10 x 16", 25.40 x 40.64cm (Image area) Media Legion Aquarella 140 lb CP Deckle Edges Inks Epson UltraChrome K3 Archival Inks

name: The Harmonic Frequencies of Butterscotch & a Shot of Rum
description: The Brushstrokes The brushstrokes are generated via gestures that are tracked using a Microsoft Kinect camera and a combination of custom and open-source code. Symmetry Inspiration The symmetry algorithm is inspired by Washburn & Crowe's book 'Symmetries of Culture: Theory and Practice of Plane Pattern Analysis'. Colors The colors come from an image that I fed into one of my Color Analytic and Visualization Illustrator plug-ins. Title Generator The title was generated using a Title Generator app I created that embraces String Combinatorics. Edition 1 of 1. Signed & hand numbered. Dimensions 13 x 19", 33.02 x 48.26cm (Paper and Image area) Media Epson Archival Matte Paper Inks Epson Claria Archival Inks Location Currently on display in Dr. Woohoo's Pixels-to-Print show @ the Santa Fe Community College through April 15th. Press Pasatiempo wrote an excellent review on the show and included this piece in the article.

name: Cherry Blossoms in Tokyo
description: The Colors The colors that form this image are from cherry blossom trees in a photo I took on my trip to the beautiful and inspiring Japan. The Technology + Inspiration "On an instrument you start from one tone. In painting you start from several. Thus you begin with black and divide up to white – the first unit, the easiest and the most frequently used one, hence the best understood. but take as many units as there are colors in the rainbow, add those made by composite colors, and you will reach a rather respectable number of units. What an accumulation of numbers, truly a Chinese puzzle! No wonder then that the colorist's science has been so little investigated by the painters and is so little understood by the public. Yet what richness of means to attain an intimate relationships with nature... the combinations are unlimited." - Gaugin Using color analytic and visualization software that I created, images are imported, analyzed and the color palettes are then visualized. The more popular the color, the larger the circle. The location of each circle is based the hue, saturation and brightness. The hue defines where the image is placed on the x-axis. The saturation and brightness are used to define the location of the circle on the y-axis. Edition 1 of 1. Signed & hand numbered. Dimensions 13 x 19", 33.02 x 48.26cm (Paper and Image area) Media Epson Archival Matte Paper Inks Epson Claria Archival Inks
